ratingCriteria.10: With X-ray evidence of involvement of 2 or more major joints or 2 or more minor joint groups, with occasional incapacitating exacerbations
ratingCriteria.20: With X-ray evidence of involvement of 2 or more major joints or 2 or more minor joint groups, with frequent incapacitating exacerbations

specialRules: Rated based on limitation of motion and/or X-ray evidence
For pre-arthritic changes, rate on limitation of motion
crossReferences: Rate individual joints separately if not covered by 5003

ratingCriteria.10: With X-ray evidence of involvement of 2 or more major joints or 2 or more minor joint groups, with occasional incapacitating exacerbations
ratingCriteria.20: With X-ray evidence of involvement of 2 or more major joints or 2 or more minor joint groups, with frequent incapacitating exacerbations

specialRules: Must show evidence of trauma
Rate based on limitation of motion if more advantageous
crossReferences: See individual joint codes for single joint involvement

ratingCriteria.30: Following total knee replacement, minimum rating

specialRules: Rate based on limitation of motion after replacement
Minimum 30% during the first year following implantation
crossReferences: May rate higher based on limitation of motion or instability

conditions.conditionName: Limitation of Flexion of the Knee

ratingCriteria.10: Flexion limited to 30 degrees

specialRules: Measure with goniometer
Rate bilateral separately
crossReferences: Combine with 5261 if extension also limited

ratingCriteria.0: Hearing threshold in better ear 26-40 dB
ratingCriteria.10: Hearing threshold in better ear 41-55 dB AND worse ear 55-70 dB
ratingCriteria.20: Hearing threshold in better ear 41-55 dB AND worse ear 71-85 dB

specialRules: Use pure tone audiometry
Rate using Table VI
Consider speech discrimination
crossReferences: May combine with tinnitus (6260)

ratingCriteria.10: Recurrent tinnitus

specialRules: Not rated higher than 10%
Bilateral tinnitus rated as single condition at 10%
crossReferences: May combine with hearing loss (6100)

ratingCriteria.10: Diastolic pressure predominantly 90 or more, or systolic pressure predominantly 160 or more
ratingCriteria.20: Diastolic pressure predominantly 100 or more, or systolic pressure predominantly 200 or more, or minimum evaluation for a veteran who requires continuous medication for control
ratingCriteria.40: Diastolic pressure predominantly 110 or more with episodes of acute congestive heart failure or subjective symptoms such as severe headaches or evidence of hypertensive heart disease
ratingCriteria.60: Diastolic pressure predominantly 130 or more, or systolic pressure predominantly 230 or more, with history of diastolic pressure predominantly 130 or more requiring two or more drugs for adequate control

specialRules: Must show continuous medication requirement for 20% or higher
Rate based on sustained readings
crossReferences: May be secondary to kidney disease or sleep apnea
conditions.presumptiveNotes: Presumptive for Vietnam veterans with Agent Orange exposure (added 2021)

ratingCriteria.10: Two or more of the symptoms of pyrosis, regurgitation, or dysphagia. Symptoms must be substantiated by endoscopic findings
ratingCriteria.30: Persistently recurrent epigastric distress with dysphagia, pyrosis, and regurgitation, accompanied by substernal or arm or shoulder pain, productive of considerable impairment of health
ratingCriteria.60: Symptoms of pain, vomiting, material weight loss and hematemesis or melena with moderate anemia; or other symptom combinations productive of severe impairment of health

specialRules: Requires endoscopic findings for 10% or higher
Must show objective evidence
crossReferences: Often secondary to PTSD or medications

ratingCriteria.0: Mild; disturbances of bowel function with occasional episodes of abdominal distress
ratingCriteria.10: Moderate; frequent episodes of bowel disturbance with abdominal distress
ratingCriteria.30: Severe; diarrhea, or alternating diarrhea and constipation, with more or less constant abdominal distress

specialRules: Diagnosis must be confirmed
Rate based on severity and frequency
crossReferences: Often secondary to PTSD or anxiety

ratingCriteria.10: Requiring insulin, restricted diet, or oral hypoglycemic agent
ratingCriteria.20: Requiring insulin, restricted diet, or oral hypoglycemic agent; and regulation of activities
ratingCriteria.40: Requiring insulin and restricted diet, or oral hypoglycemic agent and restricted diet; and one or more complications (e.g., neuropathy, retinopathy)
ratingCriteria.60: Requiring insulin, restricted diet, and regulation of activities with episodes of ketoacidosis or hypoglycemic reactions requiring at least three hospitalizations per year or weekly visits to a diabetic care provider
ratingCriteria.100: Requires more than one daily injection of insulin, restricted diet, and regulation of activities with episodes of ketoacidosis or hypoglycemic reactions requiring hospitalization more than twice a year

specialRules: Rate on level of control required
Complications rated separately and combined
crossReferences: Neuropathy (8520)
Retinopathy (6066)
conditions.presumptiveNotes: Presumptive for Vietnam veterans with Agent Orange exposure

ratingCriteria.10: Mild: One or two symptoms (e.g., headaches, memory loss)
ratingCriteria.40: Moderate: Three or more symptoms with mild impairment
ratingCriteria.70: Severe: Near-continuous symptoms with moderate impairment of work and social functioning
ratingCriteria.100: Total: Complete impairment of work and social functioning

specialRules: Rate based on three main areas: cognitive, emotional/behavioral, physical
Use ยง4.124a criteria
crossReferences: May also rate specific residuals (headaches, memory loss) separately

ratingCriteria.10: Mild incomplete; less than 50% loss of function
ratingCriteria.60: Complete; foot drop and sensory loss

specialRules: Rate based on EMG/NCS findings
Consider pain component
crossReferences: May be secondary to back injury (5243)

ratingCriteria.0: A mental condition has been formally diagnosed, but symptoms are not severe enough either to interfere with occupational and social functioning or to require continuous medication
ratingCriteria.10: Occupational and social impairment due to mild or transient symptoms which decrease work efficiency and ability to perform occupational tasks only during periods of significant stress
ratingCriteria.30: Occupational and social impairment with occasional decrease in work efficiency and intermittent periods of inability to perform occupational tasks
ratingCriteria.50: Occupational and social impairment with reduced reliability and productivity
ratingCriteria.70: Occupational and social impairment with deficiencies in most areas, such as work, school, family relations, judgment, thinking, or mood

specialRules: Must establish stressor event
Use Global Assessment of Functioning (GAF) or equivalent
Rate based on occupational and social impairment
crossReferences: Often causes secondary conditions: sleep apnea (6847), IBS (7304), GERD (7203)
conditions.presumptiveNotes: Presumptive for combat veterans or MST survivors with qualifying stressor

ratingCriteria.0: A mental condition has been formally diagnosed, but symptoms are not severe enough either to interfere with occupational and social functioning or to require continuous medication
ratingCriteria.10: Occupational and social impairment due to mild or transient symptoms
ratingCriteria.30: Occupational and social impairment with occasional decrease in work efficiency
ratingCriteria.50: Occupational and social impairment with reduced reliability and productivity
ratingCriteria.70: Occupational and social impairment with deficiencies in most areas

specialRules: Must show occupational/social impairment
Rate based on symptom severity and functional impact
crossReferences: Cannot combine with other mental health conditions; rate under highest diagnosis

ratingCriteria.0: A mental condition has been formally diagnosed, but symptoms are not severe enough either to interfere with occupational and social functioning or to require continuous medication
ratingCriteria.10: Occupational and social impairment due to mild or transient symptoms
ratingCriteria.30: Occupational and social impairment with occasional decrease in work efficiency
ratingCriteria.50: Occupational and social impairment with reduced reliability and productivity
ratingCriteria.70: Occupational and social impairment with deficiencies in most areas

specialRules: Rate based on occupational/social impairment
Cannot combine with other mental health diagnoses
crossReferences: Rate under single mental health diagnosis at highest level

ratingCriteria.0: Asymptomatic but with documented sleep disorder breathing
ratingCriteria.30: Chronic respiratory failure with carbon dioxide retention or cor pulmonale, or; requires use of breathing assistance device such as continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP) machine
ratingCriteria.50: Requires use of breathing assistance device such as CPAP machine and chronic respiratory failure with carbon dioxide retention or cor pulmonale, or; respiratory insufficiency with daytime hypersomnolence
ratingCriteria.100: Chronic respiratory failure with carbon dioxide retention or cor pulmonale and requires tracheostomy

specialRules: Requires sleep study documentation
CPAP use = minimum 30%
Often secondary to PTSD, obesity, or nasal conditions
crossReferences: May be secondary to mental health conditions (9411) or nasal/sinus issues

ratingCriteria.10: With incapacitating episodes having a total duration of at least 1 week but less than 2 weeks during the past 12 months
ratingCriteria.20: With incapacitating episodes having a total duration of at least 2 weeks but less than 4 weeks during the past 12 months
ratingCriteria.40: With incapacitating episodes having a total duration of at least 4 weeks but less than 6 weeks during the past 12 months
ratingCriteria.60: With incapacitating episodes having a total duration of at least 6 weeks during the past 12 months

specialRules: Incapacitating episodes = bed rest prescribed by physician
Rate on limitation of motion if higher
crossReferences: Compare with 5237 (lumbosacral strain)
May cause radiculopathy rated separately

ratingCriteria.10: Forward flexion of the thoracolumbar spine greater than 60 degrees but not greater than 85 degrees; or, forward flexion of the cervical spine greater than 30 degrees but not greater than 40 degrees
ratingCriteria.20: Forward flexion of the thoracolumbar spine greater than 30 degrees but not greater than 60 degrees; or, forward flexion of the cervical spine greater than 15 degrees but not greater than 30 degrees; or, favorable ankylosis of the entire thoracolumbar spine
ratingCriteria.30: Forward flexion of the thoracolumbar spine 30 degrees or less; or, forward flexion of the cervical spine 15 degrees or less
ratingCriteria.40: Forward flexion of the thoracolumbar spine 30 degrees or less AND favorable ankylosis of the entire cervical spine
ratingCriteria.50: Unfavorable ankylosis of the entire thoracolumbar spine
ratingCriteria.100: Unfavorable ankylosis of the entire spine

specialRules: Measure with inclinometer
Compare with 5243 (IVDS) and rate under higher
Bilateral factor applies if both cervical and lumbar are rated
crossReferences: May also rate radiculopathy separately if present

ratingCriteria.10: Mild

specialRules: Rate based on pain, weakness, or limitation of motion
Bilateral factor applies
crossReferences: See specific codes for plantar fasciitis (5276) or pes planus (5276)

ratingCriteria.10: Mild, weight-bearing line over or medial to great toe, inward bowing of tendo achillis, pain on manipulation and use accentuated
ratingCriteria.20: Moderate, objective evidence of moderate flatfoot with pain on use
ratingCriteria.30: Severe, objective evidence of pronounced deformity with persistent pain
ratingCriteria.50: Pronounced; bilateral or unilateral, equivalent to loss of use of foot

specialRules: Requires objective findings
Rate bilaterally separately
Must show pain and functional impairment
crossReferences: Compare with general foot injuries (5284)

ratingCriteria.10: Unilateral or bilateral

specialRules: Rate based on pain and functional limitation
Often bilateral
crossReferences: May rate as foot injury (5284) if analogous

ratingCriteria.10: FEV-1 of 71 to 80 percent predicted, or; FEV-1/FVC of 71 to 80 percent, or; intermittent inhalational or oral bronchodilator therapy
ratingCriteria.30: FEV-1 of 56 to 70 percent predicted, or; FEV-1/FVC of 56 to 70 percent, or; daily inhalational or oral bronchodilator therapy or; inhalational anti-inflammatory medication
ratingCriteria.60: FEV-1 of 40 to 55 percent predicted, or; FEV-1/FVC of 40 to 55 percent, or; at least monthly visits to a physician for required care of exacerbations, or; intermittent (at least three per year) courses of systemic corticosteroids
ratingCriteria.100: FEV-1 less than 40 percent predicted, or; FEV-1/FVC less than 40 percent, or; more than one attack per week with episodes of respiratory failure, or; requires daily use of systemic corticosteroids or immuno-suppressive medications

specialRules: Requires pulmonary function tests
Rate based on medication requirements or PFT results
crossReferences: May be secondary to allergic rhinitis (6522) or GERD (7203)

ratingCriteria.10: With polyps
ratingCriteria.30: With permanent hypertrophy of turbinates and with 50 percent or more obstruction of nasal passage on both sides or complete obstruction on one side

specialRules: Must show objective findings
Seasonal allergies alone do not qualify
crossReferences: May cause secondary sleep apnea (6847) or sinusitis (6510)

ratingCriteria.10: One or two incapacitating episodes per year of sinusitis requiring prolonged antibiotic treatment, or; three to six non-incapacitating episodes per year of sinusitis characterized by headaches, pain, and purulent discharge or crusting
ratingCriteria.30: Three or more incapacitating episodes per year of sinusitis requiring prolonged antibiotic treatment, or; more than six non-incapacitating episodes per year of sinusitis characterized by headaches, pain, and purulent discharge or crusting
ratingCriteria.50: Following radical surgery with chronic osteomyelitis, or; near constant sinusitis characterized by headaches, pain and discharge or crusting after repeated surgeries

specialRules: Requires CT scan or endoscopy evidence
Incapacitating = bed rest or treatment by physician
crossReferences: May be secondary to nasal conditions or allergies

ratingCriteria.10: With prostrating attacks averaging one in 2 months over the last several months
ratingCriteria.30: With very frequent completely prostrating and prolonged attacks productive of severe economic inadaptability
ratingCriteria.50: With very frequent completely prostrating and prolonged attacks productive of severe economic inadaptability

specialRules: Must be prostrating (bed rest required)
Rate based on frequency
Often secondary to TBI, neck injury, or PTSD
crossReferences: May be secondary to cervical strain (5237) or TBI (8045)

ratingCriteria.10: Recurrent infections with at least 2-4 exacerbations per year
ratingCriteria.30: Recurrent infections with 5-7 exacerbations per year, or; near-continuous lesions that respond to treatment
ratingCriteria.60: Recurrent infections with 8 or more exacerbations per year, or; near-continuous lesions that do not respond adequately to treatment
ratingCriteria.100: Near-continuous debilitating lesions that do not respond to treatment

specialRules: Rate based on frequency and treatment response
crossReferences: See 7806 for dermatitis

ratingCriteria.10: At least 5 percent but less than 20 percent of the entire body or exposed areas affected, or; intermittent systemic therapy required for a total duration of less than six weeks during the past 12-month period
ratingCriteria.30: At least 20 percent but less than 40 percent of the entire body or exposed areas affected, or; systemic therapy required for a total duration of six weeks or more, but not constantly, during the past 12-month period
ratingCriteria.60: At least 40 percent of the entire body or exposed areas affected, or; constant or near-constant systemic therapy required during the past 12-month period

specialRules: Rate based on percent body surface area or treatment requirements
crossReferences: See 7913 for bacterial infections
